MapsIndoors enables you to show indoor maps in your apps.
MapsIndoors iOS SDK v4 can use either Google Maps or Mapbox Maps to show and interact with your indoors maps in an iOS app.

This allows for an easy way to display a route on the MapsIndoors map. Each leg of the route can be shown individually and can be navigated by manipulating the selected leg index. Various customization options are available to adjust the polyline styling and camera behavior.
Select a Location.
Convenience: Enable LiveData for a given domain (includes default live data badged icons).
This holds the data for a single location and a marker to display the data on a map.
Select a Venue.
Get or set the info window generator (if none i set, the default internal will be used).

The route model contains the route components: The start and end point, the overall route distance, the duration using the given travel mode(s), the actual route components (legs and steps) containing the route geometry and actions (shifts, turns, climbs etc.) performed to get to the destination point. Typically this object is not manually instantiated, but returns as a result from the
The zoom level that MapsIndoors is currently using for display icons etc. on the map.
